name: Sticky Toffee Pudding
description: A rich British dessert of date cake soaked in a warm toffee sauce, best served with vanilla ice cream.
ingredients: 1 vanilla bean, split and seeds removed for use; reserve pod for sauce
1 pint vanilla ice cream (optional, but not really)
instructions: Cooking Time:
Total Time:
Sticky Toffee Pudding Cake
preheat oven to 350
combine rum, dates and vanilla beans and let stand: tossing occasionally to soften the dates
combine dry ingredients - baking soda, baking powder, flour, and salt. Reserve
using an electric stand mixer on high, cream together butter and white sugar until smooth
reduce speed and drop in one egg at a time. mix to combine
gently add in dry ingredients
place dates, along with liquid, into a food processor and pulse until chopped but not pureed.
Combine date mixture with batter.
pour batter into six 4-ounce individual buttered ramekins or disposable aluminum baking cups
bake about 25 min or until set
remove from ramekins and, using a skewer, poke holes in the tops
Vanilla Cream Sauce
bring cream, brown sugar, and vanilla bean pod to a simmer over medium high heat
add butter, stir to combine
turn off heat, let stand
pour sauce over cakes while both are still warm
serve with vanilla ice cream
